resource.name: Police Calls for Service
resource.description: The Santa Monica Police Department Call for Service information includes requests for police service made by the public, as well as officer-initiated activity. The Call for Service information provided on the Open Data portal dates back to January 1, 2006 and is updated daily. The Police Department continues to make the Daily Calls for Service Report available on their website.

resource.description: Historical counts from the various public parking lots in Santa Monica.

resource.name: Santa Monica Airport Departures Log
resource.description: Daily departure activity log from the Santa Monica Municipal Airport.

resource.name: Police Incidents
resource.description: The Santa Monica Police Department Incident information includes crime and incident reports.  The Incident information provided on the Open Data portal dates back to January 1, 2006 and is updated daily. The Police Department continues to provide an online crime mapping system that offers the ability to include data from other surrounding agencies and establish e-mail alerts to crimes in specific areas.

resource.name: Employee Compensation Report
resource.description:
The intent of this report is to capture salary, compensation and benefit information for every compensated employee in the city.

This report is run for employees who received W2's for the indicated calendar years.
columns_description: Employment Type classifies employees as permanent or temporary.
Division in which employee worked.
Regular Pay represents all base earnings such as salary pay, sick pay, vacation pay, holiday pay, etc.
Overtime Pay represents all earnings attributable to time worked in excess of the employees normally scheduled shift.
Lump Sum Pay represents payments made for vacation, sick, or personal leave cash-outs as allowed by employee bargaining agreements.
Assignment and Incentive Pay includes payments associated with hazardous or special assignments and education or longevity incentives.
Skill Pay includes payments for specialty certifications held by employees.
Outside Employer Pay includes payments made by the City to employees assigned to work special events where the cost is fully reimbursable by the outside event employer.
Other Pay includes payments for items such as uniform reimbursements, safety awards, and other miscellaneous payments not classifiable under any other earnings section.
Retirement Contributions include payments made to PERS for retirement plans for both the employer and employee share.

City Paid Deferred Compensation is a "matching" contribution made to the deferred compensation plan for employees that make contributions. The amounts matched are limited by the bargaining agreement to which the employee belongs.

Health Benefits Average includes the average cost of coverage paid by the City for medical, dental, vision and employee assistance program coverage. Employees who have opted out of medical care coverage are not included in the average.

Cash-in-Lieu of Medical Benefits includes payments to employees that have opted out of medical coverage. This column represents payments made to the employee as an incentive for obtaining their medical coverage under different means.
Total salary  and benefits for each employee by calendar year

resource.name: Biennial Operating Budget
resource.description: Operating Budget. Includes operating budget expenditures and revenues only.  Does not include capital expenditures (CIP).
columns_description:
General Ledger Description for the posting to the ledger.

Ledger Types are as follows:
B1 = Revised Budget
BA =  Adopted Budget
B2 = Estimated Actual (not used in this report)
AA = Actuals

This field identifies expenses and budget between operating and capital.
IS = Operating
JB = Capital
This is the Fund Number.
This is Fund Name associated with the Fund Number.

This is the department number.  Each department has an assigned number.

Non-Departmental is used for non-department specific transfers (interfund transfers) and obligations (ex. debt service payments, pass- through payment).
Department Name that corresponds to Department ID.
This the division id within a department. Division id is unique to a department.   A division ID can be used across multiple funds.
Division name corresponding to division id.

This is the object code that defines the specific line items.  They are generally unique to a line item.

Objects starting with 5 are expenses.

Objects starting with 4 are revenues.
This description defines the object code.  Generally a description is unique to an object.  However, this is not always the case.

This is code identifies the revenue category as presented in the budget.  This does not apply to Expenditures.  Expenditures are categorized by object sequence (511000 - 511999 = salaries and wages and 520000 - 5889999 -= supplies and expenses.

These categories do not necessarily reflect the categories as presented in the CAFR.
This corresponds to category code.
This defines the fiscal year . For ex: 2010 is FY July2010 - 2011.
Period 1. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 2. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 3. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 4. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 5. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 6. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 7. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 8. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 9. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 10. This is the month that entry was posted.
Period 11. This is the month that entry was posted.
This is the final month of the fiscal year.  For this purposes of this report, it includes period 13.  Period 13 is the adjustment period for year-end CAFR related adjustments.
Totals for fiscal year

resource.name: Active Business Licenses
resource.description: All businesses with an active business license in the City of Santa Monica.

resource.name: Registered Special Inspectors
resource.description:
In addition to the inspections required by Section 108, some construction projects require that a deputy inspector verifies specific aspects of the construction and that the specifications conform to the approved drawings. The deputy inspector is required to report these observations in writing, on an approved special inspection report form to the building official at regular intervals.

Special (Deputy) Inspections are required for:

- Concrete Strength > 2,500 psi, Shotcrete
- Reinforcement in structural decks
- Drilled in Anchors
- Field Welding or Shop Welding in a non-approved fabricator shop (includes steel stud)
- High strength bolts
- Sprayed-on fire proofing
- Pilings – caissons
- Masonry
- Wood diaphrams and sheerwalls with nailing 3 inches on center or less
- Special cases as directed by the Building Official

resource.name: Assessor Parcels Data - 2015
resource.description: Los Angeles County Valuation and property description for parcels on the Assessor's annual secured assessment rolls 2006 thru 2016. The default sort is by AssessorID and ascending RollYear within AssessorID. This dataset excludes Cross Reference Rolls (89xx-series AssessorID).
columns_description: Zip code in the situs* address, either 9-digit or 5-digit. *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.
Unit no. in the situs* address. *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.
Street name in the situs* address. *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.
Direction associated with the StreetName in the situs* address : N, S, E, W, or blank. *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.
Fraction associated with HouseNo in the situs* address (example 1/2). *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.
Geographic latitude of the parcel.
Simple row identifier comprised of concatenated RollYear and AIN.
5-digit zip code of the situs* address. *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.

City name and State in the situs* address. For incorporated cities, this should be that city name; for unincorporated areas this may be the name of the nearest incorporated city or a community name. *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.

Net taxable value = Total value minus Exemption value (LandValue + ImprovementValue + FixtureValue + PersonalPropertyValue - HomeownersExemption - RealEstateExemption - FixtureExemption - PersonalPropertyExemption).  Note: Assessed values for non-taxable parcels (isTaxableParcel?='N') are relatively meaningless and so to avoid inadvertent comingling with taxable values, the assessed values and exemption values for NON-TAXABLE parcels have here been ZEROED-OUT.

Total exemption value = HomeownersExemption + RealEstateExemption + FixtureExemption + PersonalPropertyExemption Note: Assessed values for non-taxable parcels (isTaxableParcel?='N') are relatively meaningless and so to avoid inadvertent comingling with taxable values, the assessed values and exemption values for NON-TAXABLE parcels have here been ZEROED-OUT.

Although often an abbreviated version of the recorded legal description, the parcel boundary description is NOT a legal description. It is an internal description used by the Assessor for assessment purposes.

Unique 10-digit number assigned to each parcel within Los Angeles County. This is the same as AssessorID but here stored without the imbedded hyphens (and as a number rather than text). Also known as APN.
Additional property usage detail (3rd character of PropertyUseCode).
More specific use type of the property (2nd character of PropertyUseCode).
General use type of the property (1st character of PropertyUseCode).
Total square footage of the main structure(s), excluding garage area, porch, enclosed patio, etc.
Effective year built taking into account subsequent construction, remodeling, building maintenance, etc. If more than one structure (totBuldingDataLines>1) this is the latest effective year built.
Year property was originally built, If more than one structure (totBuldingDataLines>1) this is will be the earliest year built.

Total number of building data lines (individual structures). Although the Assessor maintains a complete set of property records on paper within the parcel jackets, only up to 5 building data lines can be stored in the current property data base. The 5 most significant structures are typically the ones selected.
4-character property use code describing the overall use of the property. Breakdown by character is included in this dataset.

Situs* address of the property (HouseNo HouseFraction StreetDirection StreetName UnitNo City ZIPcode5). *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address. For incorporated cities, City here should be that city name; for unincorporated areas, City may be the name of the nearest incorporated city or a community name.
Unique 10-digit number assigned to each individual parcel in Los Angeles County. This Assessor Identification No. is also known as Assessor Parcel No
Fixture value on this assessment roll.

Y=taxable fee parcel; N=non-taxable non-fee parcel.  Non-taxable non-fee parcels are identified by having 8th digit of AssessorID either 3, 8, or 9 (i.e. last 3 digits of AssessorID either 3xx, 8xx or 9xx). Assessed values for non-taxable parcels are relatively meaningless and so to avoid inadvertent comingling with taxable values, the assessed values and exemption values for NON-TAXABLE parcels have here been ZEROED-OUT. Also, because of lesser priority given to maintaining their property records, the parcel usage, building information, and even the property address shown here for non-taxable parcels may not be up-to-date.
Total number of bathrooms, whether quarter, half, three-quarter or full bath.
Total number of bedrooms.
Improvement base year established by Proposition 13. Changes to improvement base year are triggered only by re-appraisable change-of-ownership or major new construction.
Improvement value on this assessment roll.
Land base year established by Proposition 13. Changes to land base year are triggered only by re-appraisable change-of-ownership.
Land value on this assessment roll.
Geographic longitude of the parcel.

House no. in the situs* address. If a property has more than one street address, the situs address is typically (but not always) the one with the lowest street no. *Situs pertains to the parcel’s location and almost always matches the actual street address.

Cluster codes describe a geographical area by which similar types and uses of parcels are grouped. For residential and smaller commercial/industrial properties, clusters generally identify market areas. For more complex properties,clusters may only be used for internal work flow and control.
Assessor's administrative office responsible for maintaining the property records for this parcel. Parcels are assigned based on type of property and geographic location.
Personal property value on this assessment roll.
Real estate exemption value on this assessment roll (Church, Religious, Welfare or Veteran; full or partial)
Homeowner's exemption value on the assessment roll.
Total LandValue + ImprovementValue on this assessment roll.
Latest recording date, whether reappraisable or non-reappraisable. May include fictitious dates used in special processing (such as 19670245 or 19870633) and incomplete dates (such as 19790000).
Additional property usage detail (4th character of PropertyUseCode).
Abbreviated form of property use type based on PropertyUseCode: SFR=Single Family Residence CND=Condominium R-I=Residential-Income C/I=Commercial/Industrial VAC=Vacant OTH=Other
Code that specifies the geographic area used in establishing the tax rates applied to the property.
Incorporated city name based on tax rate area.
Assessment roll year. Properties are assessed as of the January 1 valuation date (lien date) for enrollment in July and property tax billing in October.
Special parcel classification, such as type of non-taxable parcel.  Informational only.

resource.description: Public events appearing on any one of the City's event calendars.

Unique for events in a given calendar.

domain_metadata.value: All calendared events on all City public calendars

resource.name: City of Santa Monica Maximum Allowable Rent
resource.description:
Maximum Allowable Rent values are based on rents reported by current or past property owners that have not been independently verified. Thus, we provide this information as a convenience only; it is not legally binding on landlords, tenants, or the Rent Control Agency.

The Maximum Allowable Rent values listed presume the owner is in compliance with the Rent Control Charter Amendment (Article XVIII of the City Charter) and the Rent Control Regulations promulgated thereunder. In addition to these Maximum Allowable Rent values, a tenant's rent can include applicable Rent Control registration fees or surcharges (Community College Bond, Unified Schools Bond, Stormwater Management User Fee, Clean Beaches & Ocean Parcel Tax, and School District Parcel Tax).
resource.attribution: City of Santa Monica Rent Control

resource.name: Data Catalog
resource.description: The datasets, filtered views, and visualizations in the City of Santa Monica's Open Data Portal.

domain_metadata.value: All public datasets, filtered views, and visualizations

resource.name: Employee Compensation Report Graph
resource.description:
The intent of this report is to capture salary, compensation and benefit information for every compensated employee in the city.
This report is run for employees who received W2's for the indicated calendar years.
columns_description: Total salary  and benefits for each employee by calendar year

Cash-in-Lieu of Medical Benefits includes payments to employees that have opted out of medical coverage. This column represents payments made to the employee as an incentive for obtaining their medical coverage under different means.

Health Benefits Average includes the average cost of coverage paid by the City for medical, dental, vision and employee assistance program coverage. Employees who have opted out of medical care coverage are not included in the average.

City Paid Deferred Compensation is a "matching" contribution made to the deferred compensation plan for employees that make contributions. The amounts matched are limited by the bargaining agreement to which the employee belongs.
Retirement Contributions include payments made to PERS for retirement plans for both the employer and employee share.
Other Pay includes payments for items such as uniform reimbursements, safety awards, and other miscellaneous payments not classifiable under any other earnings section.
Outside Employer Pay includes payments made by the City to employees assigned to work special events where the cost is fully reimbursable by the outside event employer.
Skill Pay includes payments for specialty certifications held by employees.
Assignment and Incentive Pay includes payments associated with hazardous or special assignments and education or longevity incentives.
Lump Sum Pay represents payments made for vacation, sick, or personal leave cash-outs as allowed by employee bargaining agreements.
Overtime Pay represents all earnings attributable to time worked in excess of the employees normally scheduled shift.
Regular Pay represents all base earnings such as salary pay, sick pay, vacation pay, holiday pay, etc.
Division in which employee worked.
Employment Type classifies employees as permanent or temporary.

resource.name: Active Demolition Permits for Buildings over 40 Years
resource.description: This dataset shows all demolition permit applications for structures over 40 years old.  As a result, there may be permits listed for accessory structures exempt from demolition review pursuant to SMMC Section 9.25.020.  “Original Construction Age” is pulled from the City’s permit system but may be different than original date of construction found through more detailed research.  To view the most recent applications, please sort by “Date Plan Check Accepted” in Descending order.  This date represents the start of the 75-day waiting period.

resource.name: Enterprise Systems Catalog
resource.description:
In accordance with Senate Bill 272, the City of Santa Monica has released a catalog of its enterprise systems. Approved on October 11, 2015, SB 272 adds a section to the California Public Records Act requiring local agencies to create a catalog of Enterprise Systems by July 1, 2016 with annual updates.

Enterprise System is defined as: 

- A software application or computer system that collects, stores, exchanges and analyzes information that the agency uses that is both of the following:

- A multi-departmental system or a system that contains information collected about the public.

- A system that serves as an original source of data within an agency.

An Enterprise System does not include any of the following:
- Information Technology security systems, including firewalls and other cybersecurity systems.
- Physical access control systems, employee identification management systems, video monitoring and other physical control systems.
- Infrastructure and mechanical control systems, including those that control or manage street lights, electrical, natural gas or water or sewer functions.
- Systems related to 911 dispatch and operation or emergency services.
- Systems that would be restricted from disclosure by Section 6254.19.
- The specific records that the information technology system collects, stores, exchanges or analyzes.

Exception
If the public interest served by not disclosing the information described clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure, the local agency may instead
provide a system name, brief title or identifier of the system.
columns_description: Reporting period in which the given product was listed.
Name of vendor providing the product/service.
Product name.
Functions, features, benefits, and/or value provided by the system.
Type of system. Categories are defined internally by Information Systems Department.
Primary department responsible for the data maintained within a system. If multiple departments are responsible for data management, Information Systems will be listed as the custodian.
How frequently new data is captured by/entered into the product.
How frequently existing data updated within product.

domain_metadata.value: Initial dataset covers July 1, 2015 to June 30, 2016

resource.name: Asset Inventory (public)
resource.description:
This dataset is an inventory of the assets on the site. Here you can track the performance of data publishing, metadata maintenance, as well as present an overview of what data exists on the site.

Note: This is only updated once per day.
columns_description: The uid of the currently published version of this dataset

Has four possible values:

* Unpublished: Does not show up in catalog. Waiting to be published.
* Published: The authoritative and broadly available current copy of a dataset
* Snapshotted: An older copy of the dataset which has been saved for reference
* Copying: A dataset which is in the process of being copied internally. This is an ephemeral state.
if data is federated, the source domain will populate here
if the row represents a view/map/data_lens page etc. that is derived from another dataset = True

Last update of tabular data only, will not reflect metadata or shapefiles

resource.name: City of Santa Monica Maximum Allowable Rent Map
resource.description:
Maximum Allowable Rent values are based on rents reported by current or past property owners that have not been independently verified. Thus, we provide this information as a convenience only; it is not legally binding on landlords, tenants, or the Rent Control Agency.

The Maximum Allowable Rent values listed presume the owner is in compliance with the Rent Control Charter Amendment (Article XVIII of the City Charter) and the Rent Control Regulations promulgated thereunder. In addition to these Maximum Allowable Rent values, a tenant's rent can include applicable Rent Control registration fees or surcharges (Community College Bond, Unified Schools Bond, Stormwater Management User Fee, Clean Beaches & Ocean Parcel Tax, and School District Parcel Tax).
resource.attribution: City of Santa Monica Rent Control
